title-part.text: TRANSPORT, PERSONAL CONVEYANCES, OR ACCOMMODATION SPECIALLY ADAPTED FOR PATIENTS OR DISABLED PERSONS

reference.text: appliances for aiding patients or disabled persons to walk A61H3/00
embalming corpses A01N1/00

note.note-paragraph:
The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
A61G3/04 covered by A61G3/02
A61G7/043 covered by A61G7/05
A61G7/12 covered by A61G7/10
A61G7/14 covered by A61G7/10
A61G15/04 covered by A61G15/02
A61G15/06 covered by A61G15/02
A61G17/013 covered by A61G17/00
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: with facilities for picking up patients or disabled persons, e.g. break-away type or using endless belts

reference.text: devices in general for lifting disabled persons A61G7/10
ski vehicles A63C5/00

title-part.text: Sheets specially adapted for use as or with stretchers

reference.text: restraining devices used in nursing A61F5/37
A61G1/017 takes precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by the number of supporting wheels if stretcher is extended
2 pairs having wheels within a pair on the same position in longitudinal direction, e.g. on the same axis
3 pairs having wheels within a pair on the same position in longitudinal direction, e.g. on the same axis
other configuration, e.g. odd number of wheels
having at least one swivelling wheel, e.g. castors
with lockable swivel action, e.g. fixing castor in certain direction

reference.text: locking of castor swivel action in general B60B33/02

CPC-specific-text.text: having auxiliary wheels, e.g. wheels not touching the ground in extended position
having wheels which support exclusively if stretcher is in low position, e.g. on the folded legs
having loading wheels situated in the front during loading
having brakes, e.g. slowing down and/or holding

reference.text: details of brake actuators on castors B60B33/0078; brakes on hand carts B62B5/04; brakes in general F16D49/00 - F16D65/853

title-part.text: Parts, details or accessories, e.g. head-, foot-, or like rests specially adapted for stretchers

CPC-specific-text.text: independently foldable, i.e. at least part of the leg folding movement is not simultaneous

title-part.text: Supports for stretchers, e.g. to be placed in or on vehicles

reference.text: A61G1/0293 takes precedence; supports fixed to a vehicle A61G3/02 - A61G3/08

title-part.text: Vehicles with special provisions for transporting patients or disabled persons, or their personal conveyances, e.g. for facilitating access of, or for loading, wheelchairs

CPC-specific-text.text: Vehicles provided with medical equipment to perform operations or examinations
Supplementary seats, e.g. for doctors to take care of a patient
Means for reducing the influence of acceleration on patients, e.g. suspension systems of platforms

CPC-specific-text.text: Ventilation, sterilisation or air conditioning aspects

reference.text: in general B60H

title-part.text: Facilitating access of patients or disabled persons to, or exit from, vehicles

reference.text: transfer using ramps, lifts or the like A61G3/06 - A61G3/066; accommodating or securing wheelchairs or stretchers A61G3/08 - A61G3/0891

CPC-specific-text.text: by pivoting the support about a vertical axis
by pivoting the support about a horizontal axis
by moving the stretcher on a horizontal path, e.g. sliding or rolling
by moving the stretcher on an inclined path, e.g. sliding or rolling
by support protruding from the vehicle

title-part.text: Transfer using ramps, lifts or the like

CPC-specific-text.text: using lifts connected to the vehicle
using lifts separate from the vehicle, e.g. fixed on the pavement
using an adjustable suspension lowering device for the whole vehicle
using a lowering device for a part of the floor of the vehicle
with compartment for horizontally storing the ramp or lift

by preventing lateral movement, e.g. tracks

title-part.text: propelled by the patient or disabled person

acting directly on hubs or axis

Power-assistance activated by pushing on hand rim or on handlebar

title-part.text: with obstacle mounting facilities, e.g. for climbing stairs,

CPC-specific-text.text: with three or more wheels mounted on a rotary cross member, e.g. spiders or spoked wheels with small wheels at the end of the spokes
with extensible supports pushing upwards, e.g. telescopic legs
characterised by a particular folding direction
folding side to side, e.g. reducing or expanding the overall width of the wheelchair
comprising a scissor-type frame, e.g. having pivoting cross bars for enabling folding
folding front to back, e.g. reducing or expanding the overall depth of the wheelchair
comprising a scissor-type frame, e.g. having pivoting cross bars for enabling folding
folding up and down, e.g. reducing or expanding the overall height of the wheelchair
comprising a scissor-type frame, e.g. having pivoting cross bars for enabling folding
folding down backrest, e.g. where the backrest folds down onto the seat support
dismountable, e.g. where the wheelchair can be disassembled for transportation or storage
having locking means for maintaining a folded or unfolded condition
having rigid supports, e.g. seat or back supports which retain their shape after folding of the wheelchair

title-part.text: Parts, details or accessories of beds

reference.text: restraining in general A61F5/37
head or foot boards for comfort or ergonomics A47C19/022

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by a particular connection mechanism
covering particular sections of the bed, e.g. one or more partial side-rail sections along the bed
mounted to individual mattress supporting frame sections
covering the full bed length, e.g. from head board to foot board
characterised by safety means, e.g. to avoid injuries to patient or caregiver
Anti-pinching means to avoid injuries to body parts when moving side-rails or mattress supports, e.g. gap and grid covers, side-rail parts with special shape or electronic means for warning
Padding means to soften side-rail surfaces
characterised by integrated accessories, e.g. bed control means, nurse call or reading lights

title-part.text: Aids for getting into, or out of, bed, e.g. steps, chairs,

note.note-paragraph:
Group A61G17/00 is impacted by reclassification into group A61G17/001.
Groups A61G17/00 and A61G17/001 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group A61G17/001 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from group A61G17/00.
Groups A61G17/00 and A61G17/001 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: characterised by the construction material used, e.g. biodegradable material

note.note-paragraph:
Group A61G17/007 is impacted by reclassification into groups A61G17/007, A61G17/0106, A61G17/0136 and A61G17/0166.
All groups listed in this Warning should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group A61G17/0106 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from group A61G17/007.
Groups A61G17/0106 and A61G17/007 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group A61G17/0136 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from group A61G17/007.
Groups A61G17/007 and A61G17/0136 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group A61G17/0166 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from group A61G17/007.
Groups A61G17/007 and A61G17/0166 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group A61G17/02 is impacted by reclassification into groups A61G17/02, A61G17/024, A61G17/028, A61G17/032, A61G17/034 and A61G17/036.
All groups listed in this Warning should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group A61G17/024 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from group A61G17/02.
Groups A61G17/02 and A61G17/024 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group A61G17/028 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from group A61G17/02.
Groups A61G17/02 and A61G17/028 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Groups A61G17/02 and A61G17/036 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group A61G17/04 is impacted by reclassification into groups A61G17/04, A61G17/0405 and A61G17/0407.
All groups listed in this Warning should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: Hoisting or lowering devices for coffins
Funeral aspects of hearses or like vehicles
Subject matter not provided for in other groups of this subclass
Information related to the kind of patient or his position
with asymmetric abilities, e.g. hemiplegic or missing a limb
the patient is supported by a specific part of the body
characterised by specific control means, e.g. for adjustment or steering
by patient's head, eyes, facial muscles or voice
for automatically guiding movable devices, e.g. stretchers or wheelchairs in a hospital
with special adaptations, e.g. for safety or comfort
Impact absorbing means, e.g. bumpers or airbags
for automatic deactivation, e.g. deactivation of actuators or motors
for connecting a trolley to a device, e.g. bed or column table
by shape or form, e.g. by using shape recognition
using icons or symbolic figures, e.g. by a graphical representation symbolising the type of pathology or the organ by an image
using magnetic or electronic identifications, e.g. chips, RFID, electronic tags
Devices for specific treatment or diagnosis
driven by a patient sitting in a wheelchair
